content.description: A small toy car travels with negligible friction around a track with vertical circular loop. Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi> </math> is located at a position along the track after the car has passed by the top of the loop, as shown.
content.question:
When the car is at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, which force, or forces, has a component that results in the centripetal and tangential accelerations of the car?

Forces That Cause Centripetal Acceleration
 Forces That Cause Tangential Acceleration

A
 Normal force only
 None

B
 Normal force only
 Force of gravity

C

 None

D

 Force of gravity
